breakfast.title: Egg McMuffin
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Split the english muffins in half and toast them in the oven.
Meanwhile, heat a skillet over medium heat and cook the canadian bacon until browned on both sides.
Remove the canadian bacon from the skillet and set aside.
Crack the eggs into the skillet and cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Place a slice of cheese on the bottom half of each english muffin.
Top the cheese with a slice of canadian bacon and a cooked egg.
Spread butter on the top half of each english muffin and place on top of the eggs.
Serve immediately.

breakfast.title: Pancakes
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the milk and stir until just combined.
Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat and grease with butter or cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve warm with butter and syrup.

main.title: Steak n Potatoes
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Season the steaks with salt and pepper.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and sear the steaks on both sides until browned.
Transfer the steaks to a baking dish and top with steak sauce.
Bake in the oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the steaks reach your desired level of doneness.
Meanwhile, combine the butter, sour cream, chives, bacon bits, cheddar cheese, and green onions in a bowl.
Serve the steaks with the loaded baked potato topping.

main.title: Spaghetti with Meatballs
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Form the ground beef into meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through.
Meanwhile, heat the spaghetti sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add the cooked meatballs to the sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve the meatballs and sauce over the cooked noodles.

dessert.title: Apple Pie
ingrs: 6 cups thinly sliced peeled tart apples
steps: In a large bowl, combine the sugar, corn syrup, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Add the apples and toss to coat.
Transfer the apple mixture to the pastry shell.
Dot with butter.
Cover with a lattice crust.
Bake at 375 degrees F for 50-60 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

dessert.title: Ice Cream Sundae
steps: Scoop the ice cream into a bowl.
Drizzle with chocolate syrup.
Top with whipped cream, a cherry, and chopped nuts, if desired.

salad.title: Garden Salad
steps: Toss the lettuce, celery, green pepper, and onion in a large bowl.
Combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, and Parmesan cheese in a small bowl.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Top with bacon bits before serving.

salad.title: Caesar Salad
steps: Toss the romaine lettuce with the Parmesan cheese and croutons in a large bowl.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss to coat.
